content: mon scarf pattern by karen tate @crochetdahlia published 18th december 2023 thank you for choosing my pattern for the mon scarf it s a simple design making it a perfect project if you are new to crochet it s equally suitable for the more advanced crocheter who wants a relaxing and meditative make it s also customizable for a longer scarf chain a greater number of chains than stated in the pattern for a shorter scarf chain a lesser number of chains than stated it s worked lengthwise so you can choose how wide you want your scarf as you crochet for a wider scarf simply crochet more row materials yarn gruendl pretty 100g/166m x 2 5 balls or any aran weight yarn hook 6 0mm/j scissors yarn needle finished measurements 72 x 7 5 / 182cm x 19cm blocked gauge 13 half_double_crochet x 11 row = 10cm 4 abbreviations us terms blo back loop only chain - chain half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet st stitch 1 general notes invisible join cut yarn leaving about 10cm/4 and pull through the top of the last stitch made thread your yarn needle with this tail insert the yarn needle under both loops of the second stitch of the round then insert the yarn needle through the centre of the last stitch made and pull gently until your new loop matches the rest fasten_off - total number of stitches at the end of the row turn your work after each row chain 2 does not count as a stitch blocking is recommended to open up the stitch work and to create a beautiful soft drape experience level beginner pattern instructions foundation form a slip knot chain 230 r1 half_double_crochet into the 2nd chain from the hook and into each chain along 229 half_double_crochet r2 chain 2 doesn t count as a st half_double_crochet into the 1st st half_double_crochet-blo into each st along the row until there is 1 st left half_double_crochet into the last st 227 half_double_crochet-blo 2 half_double_crochet view my instagram reel for a tutorial half_double_crochet blo tutorial repeat r2 until you reach the desired width for your scarf i crocheted 20 row don t fasten_off border turn your work so you will work along the last row crocheted chain 1 doesn t count as a st single_crochet into each st along the row 229 single_crochet single_crochet as evenly as you can along the short edge i worked 22 single_crochet along the other long edge single_crochet into each foundation chain 229 single_crochet single_crochet as evenly as you can along the other short edge i worked 22 single_crochet when you reach the 1st st of the border make an invisible join fasten_off and weave in your ends your mon scarf is finished i d love to see your version of the mon scarf so please tag me @crochetdahlia #monscarf if you have any issues with the pattern please do not hesitate to contact me via email crochetdahliaofficial@gmail com or social media this pattern cannot
